alert.note: Alert for Southern Oregon Coast; Western Rogue Basin including the Illinois Valley; Western Siskiyou National Forest (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 09 at 4:42AM PDT until September 09 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: .Gusty winds combined with low humidities will bring critical conditions to portions of fire zones 618, 619, 620 and 280 into this evening. These same areas will also experience gusty winds and poor overnight recoveries, especially near and at the ridges overnight into this morning. A Haines 6 over the Rum Creek fire will also result in Red Flag conditions today. Low humidities and gusty east winds will also occur over and near the Southern Oregon Cascades and the Siskiyous through Saturday. Additionally breezy to gusty winds and low humidities are possible Saturday afternoon and evening from the Cascades west to the coastal mountains. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH AND GUSTY WINDS AND POOR OVERNIGHT RECOVERIES AND AND HAINES 6... * IMPACTS: Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. * AFFECTED AREA: All of Oregon fire zone 618, with the mid slopes and ridges at higher risk. This also includes the mid to upper slopes and ridgetops in the coast range of Oregon Fire Zone 619 and much of the Illinois Valley and surrounding hills in fire zone 620, including the Rum Creek Fire. * WIND: East 10 to 20 mph with gusts to around 35 mph. * HUMIDITY: Daytime Humidities 6 to 14 percent. Night time recoveries 15 to 24 percent. * DETAILED URL: View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr * ADDITIONAL DETAILS: A high level haines index of 6 is forecast this afternoon in zone 620, including over the Rum Creek Fire. Haines 6 conditions along with hot and dry conditions will lead to significant potential for large fire growth on the Rum Creek Fire this afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.

area.areaDesc: Southern Oregon Coast; Western Rogue Basin including the Illinois Valley; Western Siskiyou National Forest
